title: Script Help
content:
I need to re-type some text in this font but I cant find it no were.  
If it rings a bell to any one ?!?!

Thanks

[http://img522.imageshack.us/img522/3553/fonthelprr5.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153430/http:/img522.imageshack.us/img522/3553/fonthelprr5.jpg "http://img522.imageshack.us/img522/3553/fonthelprr5.jpg")

| --- | --- |
| [Font Help.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153430/http:/typophile.com/files/Font%20Help.jpg) | 67.85 KB |

 [‹ "barista's"- Need help identifying a font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153430/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44320 "Go to previous forum topic") [Old Guinness font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153430/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44303 "Go to next forum topic")
author: one_mack

comments.content:
Nice script. Is the purpose of the “re-type” to correct the spelling of “Delicious?”

Good luck...

No I have to compose a complete different french text, I think I have a hard one here.  
Thanks for the help.

This has similarities with some of the work of Rob Leuschke, and also some of the Paul/Koziupa fonts of Sudtipos, but I could not find an exact match in what I found from either source. I also reviewed Part 7 of the Script Font ID Guide without finding a match, so I am as curious as anyone about what this is.

- Mike Yanega

Ok, I managed to get some more info.

The font is called “BonneMaman” or “goodMomy” in english translation, the maker is unknown but my customer supplied it to me.

Thanks a million to all who helped !

Apparently this is a typeface used for a [brand of preserves](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153430/http:/www.ripedigital.co.uk/samples/case-study-variable-data-bonne-maman/), which I have bought before. I presume it is proprietary for that company.Their Plum Preserves are very good.

- Mike Yanega
